topics.body:
Since I have to go to work with dad any moment now, This will be the last one for tonight

"Fang of the Sun Dougram":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u79TyE9XYUA
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
When I was 12, I asked another kid of the same age in my class a rhetorical question about what would happen when the Sun expanded to 250 times its original size (I was obsessed with the Sun becoming a red giant at the time).

He replied with "nuclear explosion". 

Almost everyone else my age (who I know) is a fucking idiot when it comes to science.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53aca4c46368721062010300#post_53aca4c46368721062010300
Actually you'd be surprised at how intelligent children can be when they're given the chance.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53acb0016368720d27670600#post_53acb0016368720d27670600

Sometimes, they are so intelligent that scares...
topics.author: 31bee2686368722a0df23600

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53acb0376368720cec870600#post_53acb0376368720cec870600
I don't think it's scary at all. I think it's wonderful! It's amazing how kids think and come up with solutions to problems. All they really need is a bit of encouragement.
